Posts.Content: GodsPioneerWoman wrote: Howdy everyone~   I'm in my 6th month on Taxol (w/Avastin). I have chemo every other week. I noticed after my most recent chemo (a week ago) that the metallic taste and impact to my taste buds was worse than usual.  I would love to get input from those who have been doing Taxol and are on the 'long term IV chemo plan, to find out answers to the following: #1) Did the metallic taste get worse (accumulative) as your IV chemo sessions went on? #2) What coping methods did you find to be helpful to combat this issue? #3) At some point did this issue become so severe that you had to switch to a different IV chemo? If so, what did your Dr. switch you to?  Thanks! Virginia  "This is the day that the Lord has made. I will rejoice and be glad in it." Diagnosed: Oct. 2008 w/Metastatic BC Stage IV, ER+, HER2 Neg. 2nd cancer battle after 9 yrs. symptom free Dx 10/30/2008, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Taxol-How do you cope with loss of taste buds? GodsPioneerWoman GodsPioneerWoman
